programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo (Tout pour Diego) S1 (2/3)
programme.desc: «Tout pour Diego»Now married and living in 1930s America, Frida sees the ugly side of capitalism.

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays S11 (8/10)
programme.desc: Which airlines are being stingiest with their free luggage allowance?

programme.title: Inside the Autistic Mind (1/2)
programme.desc: Chris helps an autistic comedian connect with her mum and a non-speaking man find a voice.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: The best bits and favourite moments from Saturday Kitchen.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants tender annuals for high summer colour, as well as sharing his tips for growing cherries and pruning blackcurrants. Arit Anderson discovers a paradise garden in Cambridge that has become a focal point for the local community. Adam Frost heads to a beautiful walled garden in West Sussex that is both ornamental and productive, and Frances Tophill meets an enthusiast in Devon who grows a huge variety of perennial veg. Also, how one gardener transformed the alleyway behind his house into a relaxing space full of plants, as well as a grower from Suffolk sharing her obsession with tomatoes. There's also another look at some viewers' films from their own gardens.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Jo Coburn presents highlights of parliamentary proceedings from across the UK.

programme.title: Impossible S4
programme.desc: Game show in which 24 players compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day. In each episode there are three rounds, and the three highest scorers from each round play against each other in the final. The winner of this battle faces a £10,000 question.

programme.title: Eggheads S20
programme.desc: A new team of challengers take on what is probably the greatest quiz team in Britain.

programme.title: Eggheads S20
programme.desc: A new team of challengers take on probably the greatest quiz team in Britain.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British (Recession) S1 (5/30)
programme.desc: «Recession»Si and Dave discover how necessity often forced British cooks to pull out all the stops.

programme.title: Eat Well for Less? S8
programme.desc: Chris and Jordan help a convenience-loving family cook one meal for all and save money.

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes (Spain) S2 (5/8)
programme.desc: «Spain»Piers and Caroline visit a house made up of 11 specially crafted steel boxes.

programme.title: Flog It ! S17
programme.desc: Today, Flog It! comes from Dover Castle in Kent. Antique experts James Lewis and Jonathan Pratt search for items to take off to auction. James finds a hefty hunting club, and Jonathan unearths a lighter that is also a ruler. Paul Martin uncovers the story of author Ian Fleming, who created James Bond.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games S5
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, Jodie Kidd, Jamali Maddix and Suzi Perry take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quick-fire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week, resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday. Will the winning stars opt for the much-coveted House of Games decanter, or will they be tempted by the House of Games kitchen composter?

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival (York) S1 (10/20)
programme.desc: «York»Sean Fletcher and Edith Bowman go in search of tips and treats at the York Food Festival.

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect S3
programme.desc: In 2017, Lei Ying and her husband, David, snapped up a Belfast house after seeing the amount of space it could offer them. However, three years later and with their children growing fast, they have discovered that having lots of space is not always a good thing - especially when it's all in the wrong place. The layout means that mealtimes are spent in a tiny, stressful corner of the ground floor, and when they want to relax, the cavernous lounge is too big to be cosy. They are lucky enough to have a garden, but access to that is also problematic, with a tight chicane of corridors and a dangerous staircase the only route. Lei Ying dreams of a perfect kitchen, whilst David hopes for a cosy home and a safe route to the garden. Can architects Laura Jane Clark and Will Foster solve all these problems on a £25,000 budget?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. He also cuts back pelargoniums that have overwintered in the greenhouse and makes a start on sowing vegetables. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Cambridgeshire and shows us how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Dorset. Sue Kent has plenty to do to start the growing season in her Swansea garden as she creates a white border and experiments with an unusual way to grow container vegetables. And Rachel de Thame celebrates the majestic Hellebore. Plus more of the films that have been sent in to us by viewers.

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo (A Star Is Born) S1 (3/3)
programme.desc: «A Star Is Born»Dangerous politics and turbulent love shock Frida's world.

programme.title: Cunk on Britain S1 (1/5)
programme.desc: Philomena's mockumentary series taking us right up Britain's history. Starting from the very beginning with the Big Bang. Written by Charlie Brooker, starring Diane Morgan.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Faisal Islam.

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Another selection of football, music and lifestyle from around the Premier League scene.
